column5: Hello All I wonder if anyone can recommend  a local fly shop here in the GTA. A shop with  products, accessories and maybe a bit of fishing feedback. And, you can exclude Le Baron and Wilson's. It seems Le Baron has no fly fishers working there, and Wilson's, is a bit pushy and expensive. thanks and tight Lines all. Fred

I am no fly fishermen, but I do go to a lot of angling shops.   Angling Specialties on Highway 7 carries a lot of fly fishing materials - not sure about rods/reels/waders etc..  He even has a tying station set up in the back so I assume he uses it.  From the few times I was there it looks to me like a lot of float fishers buy bait there.  Store is in need of a serious clean up though.  BPS also seems to have a fairly big fly section with a dedicated staff member in the "mini store".  I have also ordered online from Reelflies.ca.   Not sure if they sell materials or only pre-tied flies.  Not sure if that was helpful, but that's all I got!!  Cheers!
With a Fly and Angling Specialties. Both in Mississauga
Wilson is OK. I will suggest you go a bit of further to Grand River Outfitters, which is professional.  http://www.grandrivertroutfitters.com/
Hi Fish I hope I'm not to embarrassed to ask, but who is BPS? Hope it's not something  I'm supposed to know Fred
bps= bass pro shop. store is located along the 400 by bass pro mills (vaughn mills mall)
There is a place in Waterdown called the Grindstone right of #5 hwy

Thanks for mentioning these. I have heard of Grand River Troutfitters, but never been to these two closer stores.  So.... what I got from Google was...  With A Fly Tackle Shop Address : 1224 Dundas Street West, Mississauga, ON L5C 4G7 Telephone : 905-949-9359  and ANGLING SPECIALTIES 325 Central Pkwy W., Mississauga 905-275-4972  I'm not sure if either place has a website.... anybody know?
The First Cast in Guelph is probably the best stocked shop around for fly tying materials. John's Fly Materials is a good local on-line store.  Dan

If you go a little further West, try Grindstone Angling in Waterdown (24 Mill Street North).  The website is a little out of date (www.grindstoneangling.com) but the staff are very knowledgeable and they carry a lot of really good quality gear at a good price.  It's worth the drive even to go in and talk to the staff!
